header:
# ref/ref_scanner_setting_lists.py
#
# This file contains predefined lists of settings for various scanner parameters.
# These lists are used to populate dropdown menus in the GUI, providing users
# with a selection of common or recommended values along with descriptive text.
#
# Author: Anthony Peter Kuzub
# Blog: www.Like.audio (Contributor to this project)
#
# Professional services for customizing and tailoring this software to your specific
# application can be negotiated. There is no change to use, modify, or fork this software.
#
# Build Log: https://like.audio/category/software/spectrum-scanner/
# Source Code: https://github.com/APKaudio/
# Feature Requests can be emailed to i @ like . audio
#
#
# Version 20250816.224500.1
# UPDATED: Rebuilt the PRESET_BANDWIDTH_VIDEO list with a correct handler value.

Extremely_Low.label: Extremely Low
Extremely_Low.description: The lowest possible reference level for hunting the weakest signals imaginable.

Very_Low.label: Very Low
Very_Low.description: Deep noise floor ‚Äî ideal for weak signal hunting.

Very_Low_1.label: Very Low
Very_Low_1.description: Deep noise floor ‚Äî ideal for weak signal hunting.

Low.label: Low
Low.description: Below typical ambient RF noise ‚Äî for sensitive receivers.

Low_1.label: Low
Low_1.description: Below typical ambient RF noise ‚Äî for sensitive receivers.

Low_2.label: Low
Low_2.description: Below typical ambient RF noise ‚Äî for sensitive receivers.

Low_3.label: Low
Low_3.description: Below typical ambient RF noise ‚Äî for sensitive receivers.

Medium_Low.label: Medium Low
Medium_Low.description: Quiet environment, low-level signals clearly visible.

Medium_Low_1.label: Medium Low
Medium_Low_1.description: Quiet environment, low-level signals clearly visible.

Medium_Low_2.label: Medium Low
Medium_Low_2.description: Quiet environment, low-level signals clearly visible.

Medium_Low_3.label: Medium Low
Medium_Low_3.description: Quiet environment, low-level signals clearly visible.

Medium_High.label: Medium High
Medium_High.description: Stronger signals, moderate local RF traffic.

Medium_High_1.label: Medium High
Medium_High_1.description: Stronger signals, moderate local RF traffic.

Medium_High_2.label: Medium High
Medium_High_2.description: Stronger signals, moderate local RF traffic.

Medium_High_3.label: Medium High
Medium_High_3.description: Stronger signals, moderate local RF traffic.

High.label: High
High.description: For strong broadcast transmitters or test signals.

High_1.label: High
High_1.description: For strong broadcast transmitters or test signals.

High_2.label: High
High_2.description: For strong broadcast transmitters or test signals.

High_3.label: High
High_3.description: For strong broadcast transmitters or test signals.

Very_High.label: Very High
Very_High.description: Max headroom ‚Äî use with caution to avoid clipping.

Very_High_1.label: Very High
Very_High_1.description: Max headroom ‚Äî use with caution to avoid clipping.

PREAMP_ON.label: PREAMP ON
PREAMP_ON.description: Turns on the pre-amplifier. A monstrous gain for weak signals.

PREAMP_OFF.label: PREAMP OFF
PREAMP_OFF.description: Turns off the pre-amplifier. The scanner returns to its natural, less monstrous state.

HIGH_SENSITIVITY_ON.label: HIGH SENSITIVITY ON
HIGH_SENSITIVITY_ON.description: Activates high-sensitivity mode. The scanner now listens for the whispers of the universe.

HIGH_SENSITIVITY_OFF.label: HIGH SENSITIVITY OFF
HIGH_SENSITIVITY_OFF.description: Deactivates high-sensitivity mode. The scanner's ears are no longer superhuman.

0_dB.label: 0 dB
0_dB.description: No attenuation. Full power! Use with caution.

10_dB.label: 10 dB
10_dB.description: A light filter, for when the signal is just a bit too spicy.

20_dB.label: 20 dB
20_dB.description: A good, solid filter for moderate signals.

30_dB.label: 30 dB
30_dB.description: A strong filter for powerful signals. Like wearing sunglasses to the beach.

40_dB.label: 40 dB
40_dB.description: A heavy filter for blaringly strong signals. It's like wearing a blindfold on a sunny day.

50_dB.label: 50 dB
50_dB.description: Extreme attenuation for signals that could damage the instrument.

Fast.label: Fast
Fast.description: Like a race car: fast sweep, low detail. Best for catching fleeting signals.

Brisk.label: Brisk
Brisk.description: A jog through the spectrum; quick enough to see the sights without missing much.

Deliberate.label: Deliberate
Deliberate.description: The perfect balance of speed and fidelity. Not too fast, not too slow.

Steady.label: Steady
Steady.description: A calm stroll, giving you time to appreciate the finer signal details.

Leisurely.label: Leisurely
Leisurely.description: A slow saunter through the noise floor, where every waveform is a work of art.

Unhurried.label: Unhurried
Unhurried.description: For the patient scientist. You'll see things nobody else can, but it'll take a while.

Slothlike.label: Slothlike
Slothlike.description: So slow you can practically see the electrons move. The highest fidelity, but you'll miss any quick events.

Slothlike_1.label: Slothlike
Slothlike_1.description: So slow you can practically see the electrons move. The highest fidelity, but you'll miss any quick events.

Ultra_Fast.label: Ultra Fast
Ultra_Fast.description: A lightning-fast sweep. Filters are wide open, letting everything through.

Very_Fast.label: Very Fast
Very_Fast.description: A quick pass through the spectrum, ideal for fast-changing signals.

Fast.label: Fast
Fast.description: A balanced speed for general purpose monitoring and signal capture.

Normal.label: Normal
Normal.description: The standard filter setting for most common analysis tasks. Not too much, not too little.

Slow.label: Slow
Slow.description: A gentle filter, giving you more time to appreciate the finer details of a waveform.

Very_Slow.label: Very Slow
Very_Slow.description: For the meticulous scientist. You'll filter out fast noise and jitter, but at the cost of speed.

Ultra_Slow.label: Ultra Slow
Ultra_Slow.description: A meditative pace. So slow you can practically see the electrons move, offering maximum stability and noise reduction.

Glacial.label: Glacial
Glacial.description: A slow crawl. Good for very detailed analysis of continuous signals and filtering out transient noise.

Glacial_1.label: Glacial
Glacial_1.description: A slow crawl. Good for very detailed analysis of continuous signals and filtering out transient noise.

Sub-Glacial.label: Sub-Glacial
Sub-Glacial.description: The scanner cries, but it's worth it. Filters out almost all random noise, giving you a crystal-clear, steady line.

Sub-Glacial_1.label: Sub-Glacial
Sub-Glacial_1.description: The scanner cries, but it's worth it. Filters out almost all random noise, giving you a crystal-clear, steady line.

Crazy_Slow.label: Crazy Slow
Crazy_Slow.description: Time seems to stop. For the most patient scientists and signals with incredible stability. The ultimate low-pass filter.

Crazy_Slow_1.label: Crazy Slow
Crazy_Slow_1.description: Time seems to stop. For the most patient scientists and signals with incredible stability. The ultimate low-pass filter.

Microscope.label: Microscope
Microscope.description: So tight you'll feel like a cellular biologist examining a single-cell waveform.

Tight.label: Tight
Tight.description: A narrow, focused view for getting up close and personal with signals.

Normal.label: Normal
Normal.description: The standard span, a balanced diet for most common analysis.

Wide.label: Wide
Wide.description: A broad, digestible view of the spectrum, great for general reconnaissance.

Ultra_Wide.label: Ultra Wide
Ultra_Wide.description: A very broad span for finding signals over a large frequency range. It's like scanning with a wide-angle lens.

From_Space.label: From Space
From_Space.description: A very broad span for finding signals over a large frequency range. It's like scanning with a wide-angle lens.

From_The_Moon.label: From The Moon
From_The_Moon.description: A very broad span for finding signals over a large frequency range. It's like scanning with a wide-angle lens.

LIVE_REALTIME.label: LIVE REALTIME
LIVE_REALTIME.description: Captures and displays the trace in real time, like a hyperactive surveillance camera.

MAX_HOLD.label: MAX HOLD
MAX_HOLD.description: Keeps the highest-level peaks on display, like a digital trophy case for signals.

MIN_HOLD.label: MIN HOLD
MIN_HOLD.description: Holds onto the lowest points, great for detecting signals that vanish in the noise.

BLANK.label: BLANK
BLANK.description: Clears the slate, preparing for a new scan. A zen state for the scanner.

VIEW.label: VIEW
VIEW.description: The standard mode, simply viewing the current sweep data.

CONTINUOUS_ON.label: CONTINUOUS ON
CONTINUOUS_ON.description: Turns on continuous sweep mode. The scanner never rests!

CONTINUOUS_OFF.label: CONTINUOUS OFF
CONTINUOUS_OFF.description: Turns off continuous sweep mode. The scanner will perform a single sweep and then rest.

Off.label: Off
Off.description: Just a raw, single sweep. Great for seeing fast changes and fleeting events, but the noise floor is high and the trace is very jittery.

Light_Filter.label: Light Filter
Light_Filter.description: A very mild smoothing of the signal, removing some of the jitter. It‚Äôs like putting a slight damper on the noise, making the trace a little easier to read.

Getting_Clear.label: Getting Clear
Getting_Clear.description: The trace becomes noticeably less fuzzy. The random spikes of the noise floor start to settle down, revealing more consistent signals.

The_Sweet_Spot.label: The Sweet Spot
The_Sweet_Spot.description: A good balance of noise reduction and display speed. The noise floor is clean, and low-level, stable signals are clearly visible.

Steady_Hands.label: Steady Hands
Steady_Hands.description: The noise floor is now very stable and appears as a thin line. You‚Äôre only seeing the most consistent signals and cutting out most of the random interference.

Deep_Dive.label: Deep Dive
Deep_Dive.description: This setting is for serious analysis. It's a highly stable trace that filters out a large portion of the ambient RF noise, allowing for precise measurements of continuous signals.

Scientific_Grade.label: Scientific Grade
Scientific_Grade.description: For when only the cleanest signal will do. This high level of averaging provides a virtually noise-free display, perfect for scientific or very low-level signal detection. üî¨

Crystal_Clear.label: Crystal Clear
Crystal_Clear.description: A deep and thorough look at the spectrum. All but the most stable signals are averaged out, offering a truly pristine view of the fundamental RF environment.

The_Observer.label: The Observer
The_Observer.description: An incredibly slow and deliberate pace. This is for long-term monitoring, allowing you to see the overall shape of the spectrum with almost all noise removed.

Meditative_Mode.label: Meditative Mode
Meditative_Mode.description: For the patient and the meticulous. This is the ultimate level of noise reduction, yielding an exceptionally smooth and stable trace for the most demanding analysis. üßò‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Max.description: Sets a full frequency range from 0 to 3 GHz.

FM_Radio.description: Tunes to the standard FM radio band (88-108 MHz).

UHF_TV.description: Tuning to the UHF TV broadcast band (470-806 MHz).
